Dear Harold:
We have been very busy here in the Twin Cities for the
last couple of weeks and I have not had much time to
devote to the project, I did get a letter from Gale
outlining an agenda for the May 3rd Utilization Committee
meeting. I am looking forward to this meeting since I
feel there are a lot of decisions needing committee
action.
This situation with the Chicago school people is getting
very complicated. Let me just review it for your infor¬
mation. After a long delay I did get a letter from Dr.
Willis telling me they would go along with the project.
On March lirth I got a note from George wanting to know
exactly what we wanted. On March 17th I sent him a three
page letter outlining our thoughts about the utilization
kits and suggesting we get together for a meeting to talk
about the kit in his office Friday, April 1st. I suggested
that Liz Marshall and Wanda Mitchell, two of the committee
members in the Chicago area, join us for this discussion.
I didn’t hear anything in response to this letter until
March 31st when George called to see if I was coming in
the next day for a conference. I told him that since I
had not heard from him, I had not planned on a Chicago
trip. In our conversation we agreed that he and Elizabeth
would go ahead with the preparation of a set of slides for
the utilization meeting in Columbus. He talked as though
he and Liz had discussed the situation thoroughly and that
she would be working on the kit and would, in all likelihood,
be the person coming to Columbus.
Neil Sherburne
Loring M. Staples
Harold E. Wood
